reviewer_info: Topical Pain Reliever Joint Care (Roll) , 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: I find Capsaicin most useful when it is applied at a strength of 0.075% from a roll on dispenser directly to my temple or the area of my skull that is most affected by spasms & pain. There are 2 additional points that I would like to stress.  Firstly, it is best applied without touching the ointment directly, as it's something you don't want to get onto your hands, where it can dangerously be transferred to much more sensitive tissue, such as eyes.  Secondly, this treatment is most effective as an adjunctive therapeutic agent, along with effective analgesia and a hot, soaking bath. I would caution those whose skin is extremely sensitive to be very careful, and I can't stand anything stronger than the 0.025% capsaicin on my neck, though should I ever need to apply it to the bottoms of my feet it should be fine.

reviewer_info: Moto Gal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment:
I bought mine originally for one of my old horses, so it's a bulk powder, fairly inexpensive, but great quality from a veterinary supply. The horse hates it and it's impossible to feed. So I decided to try it on myself. I'm 45 YO and extremely active but starting to struggle with weight maintenance and metabolism. I'm also sensitive to ANY kind of stimulant.
 On Cissus Quadrangularus I've only lost 2 lbs in 2 weeks. I'm assuming it's because of it's gelling effect making me feel less hungry before meals. Plus it works extremely well for interrupting cortisol if taken a bit before a meal. Its too early for me to tell if  the weight is simply me being more aware or truly the product. 

What has been the most apparent result how ever is 3 day female cycles, not week long, voluminous.  Women my age will understand what I mean. It's kind of like I'm 24 again in that respect.

 ALSO, I have chronically torn rotator cuffs in both arms and RA coming on in the shoulders knees and hands. ( my life has not been easy, nor easy on my body)

 I was MRI diagnosed, not self which often happens on here. The physical therapist told me at my age just keep doing what I am doing and when the tendons snap, he'll do surgery. Until then he wanted to just give me cortisone and Ketamine injections. Which I did once. Lost me insurance so I haven't had them again.
On the CQ,,, In only 2 weeks my shoulders have been feeling significantly improved, as well as my knees. My hands are only marginally better. My work and two very rigorous hobbies that make it difficult to expect any miracles.  

If you are buying this in bulk, you'll need to buy gel caps. Or wrap it in Organic, unbleached paper(sabot). The stuff tastes horrible, but for me I am seeing results worth the hassle and I like the idea of getting it in an un-processed to make it taste good form and being able to control my own dosage.

reviewer_info: BPoulter, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I have found my holy grail. 6mos ago I had a car accident, broke my neck and tore both rotator cuffs. On top of that, I have 3 herniated disks in my lower back which have been a MAJOR source of pain for nearly 15 years. Until about 2 mos ago I dealt with pain with narcotics or nothing at all because I can't use Nsaids due to the neck fusion.
I was reading in the body building forums looking for help with tendon injuries and found many references to Cissus. I decided it was worth a try and am I glad I did. Pain in both shoulders went from an 8 pain to a two in only two days!! I was amazed. After about a week I noticed that my lower back pain was not interfering with my daily activities, limited as they where. How wonderful.
I stopped using Cissus three days ago. My shoulders still feel pretty good but my lower back is raging again today. Today I started my regular Cissus dosing, 2-4 a day. I'm having shoulder surgery tomorrow. I'm in hopes the Cissus will aid in my recovery as it has other reviewers.

comment: I've had worsening right shoulder and arm pain with declining range of motion and strength and difficulty sleeping for two years. Tried therapeutic exercises, glucosamine, heat and cold packs, Ibuprofen, but nothing worked.  A gym trainer who used it after a serious car accident recommended cissus. I've been taking 3200 mg twice a day with meals for almost three months.  Dramatic reduction in pain - I think due to less inflammation - to the point where it seemed the injury was cured unless I tried certain movements or lifting with that arm.  It turns out I have a torn rotator cuff that will be surgically repaired soon (so cissus isn't a total miracle, but it sure relieved the pain).  I plan to keep using cissus after the surgery and through rehab because it made such a difference. It really should be scientifically studied for anti-inflammatory use, which is a problem for many older people like myself.

reviewer_info: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
Deb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment:
I began using different combinations of Glucosamine (with and without Chondroitin/MSM, shellfish versus shellfish-free) for at least the last 20 years.  I first began taking it sporadically due to cartilage breakdown in my knee and had great pain relief in my early 20's.  I now have osteoarthritis in my knee and ankle and would never even consider letting myself run out.

I would recommend taking 500 mg every 8 hours regularly, at the same times each day, for best effectiveness.  I also find I get my best relief from regular Glucosamine (shellfish-free) which is a great savings in money as it is so much cheaper than Chondroitin/MSM added varieties.  I can actually feel a huge increase in my pain with only just a 24 hour lack of my Glucosamine.  I don't get full relief of course, but would never be able to walk or get in/out of a car without it.

As with all medications, please talk to your health care provider before starting any new medication :-)

reviewer_info: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I tried Glucosamine HCL with Chondroitin years ago and it had no effect.  Then i saw Glucosamine for pets work a miracle on my aging dog.  Within a few weeks, she went from barely being able to get up from the floor to running around like a pup again.  So i tried it on mysef again, but this time used plain Glucosamine SULFATE.  It didn't take long for me to start feeling a difference.....and my severe knee pain was reduced to nothing over time.  I have been using it ever since and can tell right away if I foget to take it or if a diff brand does not work as it should. Glucosamine SULFATE (not Glucosamine HCL) is the form originally studied for joint pain relief and is far more effective in my experience.  I am amazed that most of the products use Glucosamine HCL instead of Sulfate, but an earlier writer noted that Sulfate is more expensive to manufacture, which may explain it.  If you have not had success with the HCL form, try the Sulfate form before giving up on this miracle supplement.  Be sure to get a quality brand, too, because some are not as effective as others. Once you use one that works, you will be able to tell pretty quickly if you switch to one that is not as effective.  Good Luck!

reviewer_info: jschrum, 55-64 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: Hyaluronan injections have been a miracle for me. I have severe osteoarthritis in one knee and was told five years ago by three different orthopedists that total knee replacement was my only effective option. But one other surgeon suggested that I at least try hyaluronan injections as they have proven beneficial for a minority of patient. I have since received an injection every six months (originally Synvisc-One and more recently Monovisc) and I am virtually pain-free despite speed walking 10-15 miles per week. I have learned that the skill of the physician administering the injection is paramount as getting the syringe into the synovial capsule demands both experience and prior examination of a recent imaging of the joint. I realize this treatment will not stave off surgery indefinitely; but, knee replacement is a rapidly advancing technology (makoplasty as an example) and if hyaluronan injections can buy my a few more years than maybe by then knee replacement will have advanced to where a single surgery can last a lifetime.

comment: I had some actinic keratosis burned off my torso resulting in a couple dozen dime-sized areas that scabbed over in a few days. As soon as scabs formed I mixed powdered hyaluronic acid with Fenix gel and applied to the ones on my left side twice a day. I just applied just the Fenix gel to the right side burns. After a of doing this it looked like the left side burns were healing faster-- scabs falling off and normal but slightly pink skin underneath. The right side still had scabs attached and when they did come off the skin underneath was redder.

reviewer_info: lara3, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I have used Hyaluronic Acid for over 35 years.  I bought it when it first came out.  I will be 70 in December.  I use nothing else on my skin.  I have very few wrinkles, just slightly around my eyes and no neck wrinkles.  I have had no surgery, no lifts, nothing.  My skin has remained as good as it was when I was 35.  I do use sun block, I cannot take the heat.  When I have had a sunburn I put HA on it and it is healed by the next day.  This is the best thing you can use.  And I give it as gifts too.  My sister cannot believe what it has done for her skin.

reviewer_info: lara3, 65-74 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: My husband burned his leg on a hot motorcycle muffler.  He was wearing shorts when he went to sit on it.  He was badly burned.  When he got home I had him wash it with cool water.  I carefully patted it dry, drenched it with Hyaluronic acid and placed a six day bandage on it.  Nothing else.  Every six days for about a month we would removed the bandage, he would bathe it with cool water, I would use the HA and another six day bandage.  The burn healed with NO scarring, no pain and no infection or any other problem.  I use it for any type of injury.  And it always works.

reviewer_info: lara3, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I was bitten during a dog fight.  Broke the skin.  Much bleeding.  I washed the wound, used the hyaluronic acid [nothing else] covered it with a six day bandage, took it off six days later, washed again with just water, applied HA, used six day bandage, this went on for three bandages.  Never got infected, never pained me, healed with very small scar.  I have used this on sunburns and regular burns.  Key is to use six day bandage so that HA remains on wound and does not get washed off.

A recalled lt hip arthroplasty.  Stryker Ceramic-on-Ceramic.  Developed horrific sqeaking and grinding.  Hospital would not let my Orthopod inject the 2 pt. Hyaluronan into the arthroplasty.  I ordered 3 products ranging in Dalton Wts of 1500-300  1 mil. right up to 2.4 mil.  I am 17 mos. now without squeaking or grinding.  No more heat felt.  No more pain, with an added bonus of my being able to raise both arms over my head again.  Health Care worker with many mini  traumas that = sever osteoarthritis everywhere.
I can not say enough about HA.  We are like our cars. My joints were no longer lubercated the way God designed them to be.  Post Op did not initiat that process.  I do not know if the oral HA is getting to the joints, or assisting my own body to produce the lubercation.  Millions world wide have issues, not the least metalosis.  It is such a simple solution and worth trying if we can get insurance to help with cost and get the FDA out of the way except to make sure the labels are correct on all HA or Hyaloronan products.

Lorraine Frechette

reviewer_info: Pat, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
I am an 83-year-old female, with advanced wet macular degeneration.  I have been treated monthly for five years with intraocular injections of Leucentis to keep the disease at bay.  

Six months ago I began taking hyaluronic acid (50mg/2x/day), for pain relief in my painful osteoarthritic knees.  I got no knee pain relief, but,to my amazement, the following month there was no retinal fluid accumulation,and I required no Leucentis shot.  This had never happened before in the course of my disease (five years).  

It has now been six months since my last Leucentis shot!  Six months without any retinal fluid accumulation!!  It is difficult not to infer a relationship between my oral hyaluronic acid supplementation and this astonishing outcome.

I would encourage any sufferer from wet macular degeneration to give hyaluronic acid a try!!

I have had burning mouth syndrome and geographic tongue for almost 3-years (34-months). Nothing has helped my constant mouth pain.  My pharmacist at the compounding pharmacy has known of my problem for the pas 3-years and has been going to different seminars gathering any info. he could regarding my condition.  The latest treatment he told me about is the Hyaluronic  Acid tablet that slowly dissolves in you mouth.  I have been using it for 3-weeks now and this past week has been the first time I have felt any relief.  It still burns but I feel this may be healing my mouth, since my pain has decreased quite a bit.  I haven't had to wear my soft plastic mouth guard at all this past week!  I hope this is the answer to my prayers, I don't know how much longer I could stand the unrelenting pain.  Please pass this info. on to doctors, as it may help their patients with burning mouth.  
My pharmacist said this is a new product, I believe the only HA supplement that comes in a lozenge form that dissolves slowly in your mouth (once per day). The company name on the bottle is Complementary prescriptions. Code #CP1125.  I truly hope this will help others, because my heart goes out to anyone with this type of suffering.

I stumbled across HA because it was an ingredient in a different compound and noticed that my skin became very smooth and without bumps whenever I would take it.  I pinpointed the HA in the compound as the effective ingredient and now take only 20 mg a day or every other day to keep this odd problem under control.  when I stop taking it (being tired of a pill) after a while I notice the problem returning, but corrects again a few days after I restart HA. reviewer_info: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I used microbially derived hyaluronic acid, 20 mg., 2 days in a row to try to improve the condition of the vitreous in my eyes.  I was seeing a lot of dark spots in my visual field that were always in the same locations in my visual field.  A retinal specialist said that with age the vitreous of the eye, which is made mostly of hyaluronic acid, can shrink and that causes the symptoms I experience.  So I hoped oral hyaluronic acid supplementation might help.  The first day I took a capsule w/o event.  The second day, w/i one hour of swallowing the capsule, all the knuckles in both hands were painful on use, and my hands felt slightly inflamed in general.  I had never had a single arthritic twinge in my life before that day.  Since then (it's been about 2 weeks), the joints in my hands have been sensitive & slightly painful to use.  I'm very concerned that the oral hyaluronic acid triggered an auto-immune response in me, and that I may experience other negative effects of this auto-immunity including worsening of my eye condition, accelerated skin aging, and further joint issues.

comment:
I began using Boswellia (AOR Maxi-Boz, from Canada)about ten years ago for knee pain. I had been prescribed Boswellia before at the Arya Vaidya Shala Research Hospital in Delhi as part of a course of anti-arthritis treatment that worked very well. At the time they impressed on me the importance of using high quality supplements backed by research, which is why I chose AOR.

comment: Let me start by saying that I take a lot of natural supplements every day, but if I had to choose only one, it would be MSM. reviewer_info: AlSwilling, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I used MSM to treat bursitis in my left shoulder. It was so severe, I could hardly lift my arm. Showering was an ordeal, because I didn't have enough range of motion to use my left arm to shower properly. My wife's cousin told me about MSM, and brought me a mixture of MSM and vitamin C powder (half-and-half) to try.

I began my dosage at 1/4 tsp. per day of a half-and-half, mixture of MSM and vitaminC powder. After a week, I increased the dose to 1/2 tsp. per day for a week; then increased the dosage to 3/4 tsp. per day the third week. 

Two or three days after I began taking the MSM, I began to feel better and had some improvement in my range of motion.  Three weeks into the treatment, the bursitis was gone, and I had full, pain-free range of motion in my shoulder. I continued taking the MSM mixture at 3/4 tsp. per day for two weeks after the bursitis disappeared. It has been more than 10 years, and the bursitis has not returned.

I stopped taking the MSM, because my job was a physically demanding one, and I found that the MSM caused my perspiration to smell awful. I stopped taking it because of that.

A word of advice for those who might experience stomach upset when taking MSM: mix it in juice or coffee, and it will help alleviate that problem. 

I found that increasing the dosage by too much at a time gave me a terrible headache at the base of my skull. I found that increasing the dosage by 1/4 tsp. at a time and keeping that dosage for a week before increasing the dosage kept the headaches from occurring.

MSM worked beautifully for me. It completely cured my bursitis.

The overview on this site says that it's safe for 3 months or less. Since it's naturally occurring nutrient, found in many foods and on the skins of most fruit, I think small doses on a daily basis would be safe. It is definitely an effective treatment for bursitis in larger doses; so it makes sense that small daily doses would help maintain joint and bursa health.

But an added bonus is that my fingernails, which used to be as soft as paper, are now hard and shiny. My hair is noticeably shinier and there are fewer grey hairs, and my skin is clear and soft. I recommended MSM to several friends and they all reported similar improvements. My friend with Lupus said she has had great results on 10g/ day. My boyfriend had Rosacea but now his skin is clear. I truly believe MSM was somehing a lot of bodies needed to be healthier. I take a vitamin C gummy every day as well.

I have been taking MSM ordered from Vitacost for 6 months now... on a scale from 1-10, my pain subsided from a "8" to a "6" by the end of the 2nd month.

Now, after six full months, my pain has subsided to a "two"!... a "two"!!!

My only wish is that I would have given "alternative medicine" a chance many years ago instead of listening to my doctor who said taking such products as MSM was "quack medicine." And in addition, believing doctors such as the one that operates "Quackwatch.org" who also said MSM is quack medicine. ( http://www.quackwatch.org/ )

Instead, the alternative medicine, MSM, which according to WebMD has no evidence to support such beneficial claims as mine, has worked 100% better than any "medicine" (with known detrimental side affects" prescribed to me by "sanctioned" practitioners of health over the past 12 years. 

By the way, my doctor smokes, drinks alcohol, and is about 50 lbs overweight... so I asked myself.. "Really? I'm going to listen to "doctor" that has absolutely no understanding of nutrition, and little understanding of "alternative cures"??? 

Anyway, I have shared my experience.

reviewer_info: Hello!Tsuki, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
comment:
MSM has become a staple for me over the past few years.  I began taking it for general health and wellness reasons and have had some great ancillary results, like glowing skin, thicker, faster growing hair, strong nails, wounds heal quickly, less soreness with any bumps/bruises, more flexibility....the list goes on.  There are a few things I would recommend when trying MSM for the firs time:
1. Use a brand that offers the pure, powdered form.  Vitamine Shoppe brand is 100% MSM with NO other fillers like silica.  I have tried pills and even other powders and they simply aren't as potent for me.
2.  Start with small doses (1/4 tsp) and gradually increase while making note of any side effects.
3  Drink LOTS of water with this, it acts as something of a detox so you may notice acne or headaches at first (I did).  The water will help with that.
3.  Try to take it as early as possible.  This product gave me intense, vivid dreams unlike any that I've ever had before.  This effect went away quickly and water consumption helped.
4.  MSM in the poweder form is incredibly bitter.  I've come to appreciate this, but if it's too much for you in the beginning try mixing it into grapefruit, orange, or cranberry juice.  The vitamin c helps with absorption considerably, so always have water afterwards.

comment:

She lives several states away. Ive known her for about 20 years. Recently I told her I was having back pains and tried everything to Yoga to working out to chiropractor and nothing helped. She told me to take MSM as she has for years and now 80 yrs old and still loads 80 pound bales hay in her barn every year by herself. 
She told me to go to a feed store to buy the horse dosage and not the store bought brand. The store bout is full of fillers. So I did as she said and took one teaspoon four times a day. She also told me I needed to take with Vit C or it wouldnt do any good. So I do this four times a day with 1500mg of Vit C daily.

My hair is thicker (Im 57 yrs old), my "liver spots" are gone, my finger nails are growing like weeds, My skin feels like silk and the few wrinkles I had around my eyes are gone... needless to say my back pain is gone as well. reviewer_info: a9ymous, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: Four months ago I started gradually taking MSM in higher doses, with equal amounts of vitamin C and lots of water, for osteoarthritis, poor nails and hair, and to improve skin health during weight loss. I read that it helps accelerate cell turnover and disposal of toxins and other 'garbage' as it does so, improving the quality of new cells so that you are basically rebuilding yourself better over time. I worked up to 4000mg daily (+ 3g vit C) over a month, and now maintain at 3000mg. I did find a lot of water was necessary, and for about 6-8 weeks I had mild detox symptoms that changed around. Like a teenager, I needed to sleep and eat more during the adjustment period. It also caused my menstrual cycle to shorten (both interval and duration) for two cycles, but the cramps and so on were much diminished and the cycle normalized after the first two; it remains shorter, but interval is back to normal. My skin, hair and nails are visibly improved. My nails are much stronger and my hair seems to be growing a little faster. Along with quercetin, MSM appears to be helping with allergies. I seem to recover better after exercise. I also use a topical MSM lotion on injured sites (feet, hip and low back, knee) for additional support. Due to multiple issues I have been taking various supplements for a long while with good effects, and so far I'd say the MSM protocol is in the top 5 discoveries I would recommend to anyone, along with magnesium (even better together). I look forward to the long term benefits.  To better tolerate the detox effects, work up slowly, adding 500mg a week to the target dose, and you can take extra for critical use after injuries or severe exertion (marathons, etc.). Extra water is essential as MSM can be drying and even constipating otherwise. MSM can be taken as a powder in beverages or in capsules. It's also available combined with C in  powdered drink packets for convenience during crises like illness or injury.

reviewer_info: Doloresgrimm, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I have PCOS, and although there are a multitude of symptoms that stem from it, the root problem is that my cells are resistant to insulin. I read a student paper I found online by someone named Stephanie Seneff regarding a thesis on sulfur deficiency. The part regarding the lipid raft made me want to try MSM for my condition. Also, according to the thesis, vegetarians are vulnerable to a dietary sulfur deficiency because of the depleting nutritional value in soil, so that is also applicable to me because I have been a vegetarian for about 13 years.

I can't taste MSM in plain water or flavored water. It tastes horrible in tea--even herbal tea. I don't know if it is because of the heat, or if MSM enhances the taste of tannins. 

I feel well, I lose about 2 pounds a week, and I have periods much more regularly now. It is difficult for me to pin it on a single cause, and I doubt it is because of one change anyway, but I have also made a lot of improvements to my nutritional intake, greatly reduced salts and simple carbohydrates in my diet, and am using essential oil extracts (such as tea tree and lavender) to help regulate my condition. 

My anus was a little sore for the first 1 1/2 days after I started taking MSM, but I put a little grapeseed oil on it once, and I haven't had a problem since.

I have started giving my dogs a teeny pinch of MSM in their water because they are also vegetarians and because dogs are known to have sore joints in old age. My childhood dog Sugar--who incidentally was not a vegetarian--became very sensitive in her joints roughly around her 14th birthday, and I'm trying to stop the same thing from happening to my current companions. There have not been any adverse consequences to date, but I did apply preemptive grapeseed oil.

I don't see my brand on the dropdown list, so for the record, I use Omica Organics Plant-Derived MSM crystals. Dose: 1/2 teaspoon two times daily.

I will provide updates if anything significant happens.

reviewer_info: lonaldo, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I have had rheumatoid arthritis since I was a teenager, I am now 62 and have been in a severe flareup for 9 months. I was taking 400 mg plaquenil, 400 mg celebrex, 20 mg prednisone, and 500 mg of pain killer a day which stopped about 75% of my pain, but after 8 months I had very little improvement in movement and felt like I was just stopping the pain, the underlying problem was not getting any better. I was begining to get desparate since my doctor was going to start reducing my prednisone, whichs was the main drug keeping my pain level down. I came across an article on MSM and thought I would give it a try. I was hoping that in 4-6 weeks I might see an improvement. I started out taking two 1000 mg capsules a day. I was amazed that after one day of taking MSM, I awoke the next morning aware that I felt much better than normal and that my pain was almost completely gone. I am definitely getting better everyday. I even forgot to take my other meds severaly times due to the fact that I was pain free. I can't say if this is going to be a permanent return to a normal life, but in my 62 years of having arthritis, nothing has ever helped reduce the pain as fast at MSM. I am only writing this in hopes that it may help someone else as much as it has me. I was just about ready to give up on life due to the extreme pain I was suffering. My rheumatoid factor was over 750 and my SED and CRP readings were also way off the charts. I have my fingers crosed that this is going to be a cure for my condition, not just a short term gain. My improvement may have been a coincidence with my starting MSM, but after 9 months of relentless pain, for what I experienced the day after starting MSM, I have to bet it was the MSM that stopped my pain. So far no side effects. I will post again in a month to let everyone know how things are progressing.

reviewer_info: Thomas, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment:
I have taken msm for 4 months. I was getting sick a lot as well as having acid reflux, allergies, eczema. I also have hypogonadism, so when my testosterone levels get low I get tendonitis and muscle pain. In four months this is what I have noticed.... I stopped catching colds and I was around sick people and children constantly. I kissed my wife who had just gotten strep and didn't catch it. It boosted my immune system. Some tendonitis I had in my hand went away. My allergies were not bad at all this season, but I am not sure yet if it has helped with the eczema. It didn't really do anything for my acid reflux either. I did notice wounds healed quicker and I got a boost of energy that felt like it came out of nowhere. Times of the day where I would feel exhausted are now times where I have energy and am ready to go workout or tackle heavy duty projects.

What I will say is that the dosages are very ambiguous. There doesn't seem to be a standard dose yet because there really isn't any extensive research that has been done. I currently take 3 - 1000mg doses a day with a meal. At this level I have been getting some slight headaches and minor reactions, so I am going to dial it back to 2 - 1000mg doses a day. 2000mg a day was what I was taking and getting no side effects. At some point I might dial it back to 1000mg a day.

reviewer_info: Dmoey, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: It took close to two weeks to notice a difference or effect it had on my body. Sometime after I had been on MSM for approx. two weeks, I rode my bike for 5 miles, and later that night I played in our first softball game of the season. Keep in mind, it was my first bike ride I've taken in a while too, so I wasn't in tip-top shape. I was 40 years old and an ex college QB. Well, the next day I had zero soreness anywhere in my body! And, if you play softball then you know you are usually filled with lactic build-up for a good three days after a game, let alone the first one. But, that whole year I was never sore and never pulled any muscles like usual, and not once did I get sick! Even the normal sinus colds that usually happen to me twice a year never occurred, and I live in Ohio where the "four seasons" are profound. I'm a believer. I started taking it because I was caring for my older brother who had brain cancer. So, all the research I did led me to believe MSM would cut down on the lactic acid. So, I found out personnally that its true!!

reviewer_info: Prairie Ed, 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I have arthritis throughout my body and both knees are bone-on-bone. I also have a lot of tendon pain from various heavy jobs I've done. And I'm getting old so I have less stamina. I switched to a Sam's Club brand and believe it is not as effective as my 30 year old Schilling spice. I have noticed other areas of physical improvement that I might attribute to the turmeric but can't be sure.  Plus, I am a born skeptic so this product has truly surprised me.

reviewer_info: mts622, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: Two and a half years ago I began suffering from osteoarthritis of my hip.  I could barely walk or sleep because of the extreme pain.  A friend reminded me that turmeric was an anti-inflammatory, and I remembered that I had half a bottle of Organic India Turmeric Formula in my drawer.  Although the bottle of Organic India Turmeric Formula said to take 1 to 2 capsules twice a day, I muscle tested myself and my testing showed that I needed to take 3 capsules 3 times a day for a total of 9 capsules a day.  It took four days to it to build up in my body, but by the fourth day I was free of pain.  Note: You MUST take turmeric after eating or with food; otherwise, it does upset your stomach much like taking ibuprofen on an empty stomach.  I also find that it is best to space out the time pretty evenly between breakfast and lunch and between lunch and dinner, because if I let too much time elapse, my hip starts letting me know it is there.

reviewer_info: Unabellaluna, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment: I make turmeric milk: 1c Almond Milk, 2tbs Honey, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp turmeric paste (1/2 cup clean water, 1/4 cup turmeric - boil until turns to paste - stores for 2 wks)and 1 tsp coconut oil.  I make this every day for my husband and I; my husband suffers from degenerative disk disease and I suffer from depression and anxiety; both of us can definitely tell a difference on the day's we don't have time to make our turmeric milk.  The pepper and oil increases the bio availability of the active compound in turmeric; I've read that the encapsulated form really only provides you with about 8% of the compound, while if you make it according to the above recipe it increases your intake of that compound by about 60%.  Like I said, it has done wonders for my husband and I.  We swear by this.  My husband's mobility increased, pain decreased (36 years old) and my outlook, optimism, ability to concentrate, skin, hair, nails have improved dramatically; additionally, the pain I felt in my hips, knees, shoulders, migraines have decrease significantly.  My husband and I have experienced absolutely NO negative affects from taking turmeric. :)

reviewer_info: nature's bounty, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Since I learned that products containing turmeric and its' concentrate curcumin are derived cheaply from using carcinogentic solvents chiefly 1,2-dichlorethane a Class 1 substance that the USP has stated is a "known human carcinogen...enviromental hazard"; I have found it difficult to obtain this product with an assurance that the manufacturer did not use products containing this chemical or extrative methods using it.
I guess tumeric can be deemed organic, but the extraction of the concentrate is usually not an organic process- a subtle difference never noted. 
So a product that is supposed to prevent cancer can easily become one that most defintely does.
    An article by Dr. Liva ND RPh states that of the 30 turmeric products he tested, only 2 had levels near the ppm of less than 5 (USP guidelines) at near 6ppm; the next level was 18ppm on up to 3270ppm, all proven detrimental to one's health.
   Products have been recalled by Health Canada which was mandated to test supplements in 2004, some of them tumeric products because of the high levels of 1,2-dichoroethane.
  I also discovered testing is not done in the US nor is not required by the FDA which states that a manufacturer conduct tests only if they 'know' such banned substances have been used.
I assume then it pays not to 'know'. 
What manufacturer who uses a product that is cheaper will pay to discover if it is so because it used such banned substances?
This makes for an dangerously un-informed consumer and I wish there was some standard that tests these products for such chemicals!

I have been suffering for the past 20 years from a candida yeast infection and finally diagnosed problem and found the cure.  I purchased Turmeric 1000mg capsules from puritans pride and began taking them 1 per day along with a multivitamin. I hope others suffering from the illness find similar results.

reviewer_info: Mike, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment: I normally don't take aspirin as it doest work for me and it causes my stomach to feel pain and alcohol will exasperate this to the point I can feel acid going up into my esophagus. Antacids that just contain calcium carbonate only last about an hour and my symptoms are back again. My symptoms disappeared when I started to take 1000 mg with a glass of orange juice in the morning instead of the rda of about 90 mgs in a multivitamin. I later learned that all of the nonprescription vitamin c sold in Canada actually contains less than the amount that is described on the label as some of it goes rancid after awhile. I later learned that taking 1000 mg will still give you about 300 mg worth which is more than the recommended dietary allowance of 90 mg per day for men and 75 mg for women.

reviewer_info: Vitameatavegamin, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: I began taking large doses of vitamin C in 1972 after suffering one cold after another for months, when I was in high school and I had two little sisters at an age where they brought home every conceivable virus. I based this trial on the reading of the new book by Linus Pauling, Vitamin C and the Common Cold. My life changed dramatically as I ceased getting colds as long as I kept taking at least 4-5 grams (4,000-5,000 milligrams) every morning without fail, and then an additional 1-2 grams after supper. Later, I found I needed more, and if I did begin to feel a virus coming on, I found that I had to take extra, up to 8 grams at a time, to stave off or reduce the impact and symptoms and duration. Often I need to then take an additional 2-4 grams every few hours in the first day or two to knock the virus out or almost out. If waiting more than a few hours when the very first symptoms begin to come on, it is less effective. If waiting more than a half a day it may do very little and you get the cold almost as you would without it. One thing I had to start doing after a number of years was take calcium and magnesium with the C to buffer it. I had big problems with ester-C and other pre-buffered C's which were too alkaline and messed up my gut worse than the pure C which is too acidic. I had to find a balance that worked for me. I have also successfully used C to stop the flu from progressing past the first few hours. C is the one vitamin I would never do without, if I could only afford to buy ONE supplement this would be it. I am amazed more people don't use it like my wife and I have learned to do, but you do have to take a LOT for it to really work this way. If you have a very direct exposure to a virus and not enough sleep, etc., then this will only do so much good, but normally it works incredibly well if you take it every day and take enough for you. There were a few times I tried stopping taking it but always got more colds again so went back.

That night I took 4000mg of Vitamin C, an ibuprofen, the Bromphenir, and drank about 24oz of water. Woke up feeling the best I felt since I started coughing. All I added was the Vitamin C. So I would definitely say that taking Vitamin C for this and probably similar kinds of illnesses would have a good overall impact. Plus it's a cheap treatment that has few side-effects. Well worth it in my opinion.

comment:
I first started taking Petadolex when I was ten, and traveling abroad. My mother had been using it daily to ease migraine headaches for several years. My migraines were blinding, puking pain for hours up to days. Sometimes I would get background headaches that would be on and off for several days. So we tried taking butterbur as soon as I got any early warning symptoms. Almost invariably, if I take it within half an hour of early symptoms, the migraine stops completely within 15 minutes. More than 3/4 of the time, if I take it after early warning, when the full headache starts, the migraine intensity is lessened significantly. Often, this is the difference between days of pain, and sleeping at night.
I don't take it every day as a preventative, just when I get symptoms or know I will be around a lot of triggers.
I've never needed to get other medicine prescribed for migraines, since this works so well.

reviewer_info: on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
comment: Caffeine withdrawal can produce moderate to severe headaches accompanied by nausea and dizziness, lasting over 12 hours.  The headache usually appears 1 to 2 days after suspended use.  These symptoms can be treated with a dose of caffeine eliminating them within 10 minutes.  This is why headache preparations with caffeine are so effective while pure aspirin provides no headache relief from a caffeine withdrawal headache.  Those sensitive to caffeine may experience a caffeine withdrawal headache with the consumption of a single cola soft drink.  The 1 to 2 day delay of the headache makes it hard to associate the cause and effect.

reviewer_info: Tim, 55-64 Male  (Consumer)
comment: All caffeine drinks are not equal. Not including simple mixes such as soda, or "Red Bull" like drinks which add caffeine, drinks like Tea, Coffee, and Chocolate (Cocoa) are for the most part derived from simple beans. Because beans haven't begun development yet they contain primarily simple compounds. Tea however is derived from a leaf. Leaves are complex factories that produce hundreds of compounds... one of which is Theanine. This compound counters the bad effects of Caffeine (more or less depending on leaf content). As a result Tea should be considered different from other drinks. Also if consumed as a whole leaf either steeped multiple times (Chinese method known as Gongfu) Tea  provides huge doses of antioxidents with decreasing levels of Caffeine allowing Tea to Wake you in the morning, keep you throughout the day, and put you to sleep soundly at night. This due to decreasing Caffeine, and the soporific (sleep inducing) effect of  Theanine.

reviewer_info: Brandon, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Consumer)
comment:
Clearly this is a drug we all love, and love to hate. I think it speaks for itself. I was told by my gasterointerologist that it is a great laxative. Just a word to the weary about that, I'm not sure how accurate the side effects page on this is listing diarrhea as a "rare" side effect, but I suppose the days where insomnia is your only company and the next day of work mocks you for it, on those days it's worth putting up with the less than pleasant side effects for the ability to stay up and get the job done. Just remember to back off the stuff when your hands start shaking, figure out how long it takes to get through your system and space out the caffeine in those intervals to avoid overdose. for me it's about 2-3 hours. Body weight plays a factor, I happen to be a lean man in his mid 20's, so you may have separate circumstances. It is easy to build up a tolerance similar to alcohol requiring substantially more to get the same effect. This also creates a chemical dependency that can cause migraines when your brain is deprived of it. I avoid this by putting up with the migraines for a few days and avoid caffeinated food and supplements for up to 3 months. After that time I generally have brought my brain's chemical dependency to next to nil and my tolerance back down to healthier levels.

Always in moderation, and remember, never do any physically demanding activities when you've taken caffeine, it reduces lung capacity and robs your muscles of nutrients causing them to fatigue very fast under strain. You can create heart problems if you are under it's effects and subject your heart to too much strain, your base heart rate is already elevated and the extra strain can be painful to endure.

reviewer_info: shari, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
comment:
My 96 year old mother has been able to reduce her
medicines to just 3 of them plus vitamins.  She
takes 25 mg lovastatin, 2 baby asprin and 25 mg
sertraline.  I had been giving her CoQ 10 as well.
When I stopped for a few weeks her age-related and
post TIA-mini-stroke Dementia got much worse.  Her
thought processes and mind-body connections became
very impaired making it difficult to communicate
with her effectively and difficult for her to stand or walk a couple feet.  I started giving her
the CoQ 10 again, and it was amazing.  Within 48 hours her previous physical and mental abilities returned.  She can complete her sentences which are again coherent, she can understand what I say,
and she can stand up for 5 minutes, walk across the room and even play Scrabble with me.  Without
the CoQ 10 it had become so difficult to take care
of her at home over a 6-8 week period that I thought I would have to put her in a Care Home. 
I read that Lovastatin causes CoQ 10 deplepletion
(along with the aging process).  I was totally amazed how fast CoQ 10 worked to reverse the totally debilitating process that was getting worse and worse for my mother.  With CoQ 10 daily,
(and blueberries) my mother is 96 years YOUNG again.    I have learned the hard way (both for myself and my mother) that it is very important to

reviewer_info: Lethe, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: This is more a question for the experts than a review.   I am a 60 year old female, and I have been taking co-Q-10 supplements daily for over 20 years.  I began taking it after reading a research paper that indicated that co-Q-10 might be effective in increasing immune response.  My whole life prior to that time, I was extremely susceptible to infections; if someone with the flu or a cold even looked at me across a room, I got sick.  I was constantly sick as a child, and as an adult suffered what seemed like a continuous cold throughout the winter, along with episodes of the flu, bronchitis, etc.  NOTHING helped, not dietary intervention, not the then-popular vitamin C dosage, nothing.  After several months of taking a combined dose of co-Q-10, vitamin E and lecithin (a cocktail suggested in the research paper), I noticed that I was not getting sick as often.  I have continued the same dosage since that time, and I have not had a single cold while taking it.  No colds, no flu, no bronchitis, nothing. I did suspend the dosage for several weeks two or three times, to see if it made a difference.  It did.  Caught a cold.  Started dosage again and returned to cold-free status. (I should note that after reading reports earlier this year that long-term dosage with vitamin E could be harmful, I discontinued the vitamin E portion of the cocktail.  I have not noticed any decrease in effectiveness).   So I am curious to know if there have been any further studies on this effect of co-Q-10.  Is it possible that this could be a placebo effect of such lasting duration?  What say you, experts?  Inquiring minds want to know. ^_^

reviewer_info: Nikki, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: I took a daily recommended dose of 3000mg of CLA for about 4 months for weight loss. I gradually began to notice that my urine had become dark, and my stool had become pale (clay-colored). I got on WebMD and searched the symptoms, which suggested a liver malfunction. So I googled "CLA and liver problems" and found several clinical studies on the issue. When tested on lab rats, the CLA caused a condition called 'fatty liver', which in turn caused the liver to not function properly due to a low output of biles (which color your stools brown, etc). I discontinued the use of CLA and my urine and stools returned to normal. I wanted to share this info with whomever may take this supplement, in hopes of preventing any long-term negative effects.

reviewer_info: Jenni, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I began taking this mainly for it's immune- boosting function. What I noticed first was that the fungal infections that kept popping up periodically on my foot and the crook of my elbow (the tinnea variety) went away and haven't returned. I also noticed a lack of the usual seasonal sinus infections and irritation I get during allergy season. The most surprising was that while on it, in addition to a new habit of jogging, I lost 20 lbs. Obviously the jogging caused most of this, but when I ran out of Cordyceps for a couple weeks I noticed that despite my regular jogging I began to have cravings for fatty foods and treats and wanted to fill my stomach up as I had prior to losing weight. I began the Cordyceps again and my cravings diminished and was again satisfied with eating just enough and not stuffing myself. I found it easier to make good food choices. I notice that I seem to have less episodes of heart "palpitations" especially if I drink alcohol or coffee, as I did before. I do not feel a "rush" of energy from the pills, but have noticed I am generally feeling better, even with lack of sleep. I look forward to the treadmill, and it's hard to say, but it seems it helps my motivation in that. I have been taking Cordyceps daily for a little over a year.

reviewer_info: Paul, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I tske a 97% purified Rx grade of EPA. I have elevated Triglycerides and LDL cholesterol. Since taking this medication I've never felt better physically and emotionally. 1. No Dry eyes at all, my eyes have never felt better. They have definitely improved, my eye sight has not changed (gotten worse) in four years since my last visit, just saw the eye doctor and told him about Vascepa. He recommends Fish Oil to patients with dry eye syndrom. 
2. Definitely can think more clearly than previous, I'm able to focus better on the task at hand, although my mind tends to wander alot. My response to people I work with is more concise. 
3. My mood is steady but depends upon the wife, she knows how to push my buttons that's for sure.
4. Definitely can see changes in my energy levels, although I haven't changed any personal habits like eating and beginning an exercise program. Still in all I feel more energetic when I get off work.

comment:
I've had lifelong sinus problems.  Been using eucalyptus oil as an inhalant for serious sinus congestion and pain for a  while.  It works amazing.  Steam vaporizer or just a few drops in a glass and stick it under your nose.   If your nose/sinuses are raw this is the best treatment ever.  It feels so good.  Stick a small container with a cotton ball soaked in the eucalyptus oil under your nose while you sleep.  Your nose/sinuses will feel TONS better in the morning.   And it smells awesome.

Recently i have been experimenting with adding it to my saline nasal spray.  This works extremely well too.   1 drop added to .5 ounce bottle of saline.  And then 5 drops of that added to my nasal spray or a neti pot solution.   Extreme dilution is the key.  if you use it too strong you WILL be sorry because it hurts like crazy.   if this happens eucalyptus vapors will make it feel better.  (go figure)

So far the results are very good.  Congestion is under control.  And i believe it is effective in combating a sinus infection just starting.   Seems to kill just about anything you could want killed off.  Antibacterial, antifungal, antimicrobial.

reviewer_info: jmb, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
comment: I wish I had found this before having my uterus removed. I continue to have the same PMS symptoms with my cycle and the breast pain/swelling, bloating and water retention increased to an all time high. This is not an wonder pill that works all by itself. I recommend each person works with a qualified natural therapist to do a work up of hormones and endocrine system as well as nutritional deficiencies and sensitivities. I follow an organic diet free of allergens and only take primrose oil on day 14-28 of my cycle (it took time to figure out since I don't have one now) as it helps to boost progesterone. I also take daily vitamins, C, D3/K2/A, B-complex with extra B6, magnesium and natural thyroid. I also took measures in my home and personal products to remove any hormone and endocrine system disruptors that cause estrogen dominance symptoms. Look up Progestelle and Womens Voices for the Earth for help. Any Western GYN who will tell you that primrose oil causes more problems is due to the fact that they have ZERO training or expertise in nutrition and supplementation. They are not trained for wellness/health or an ounce of nutritional knowledge, they are trained to attack symptoms of illness with synthetic pharmaceuticals and surgery. Remember it is a business and they will only use modalities that make money. I should know, I have been a healthcare professional for 20 years and have extended training to the natural way because it is the only way out of this mess. Your body does not recognize synthetic substances with chemicals and additives in pharmaceuticals. At best they just mask the symptoms while your body is now required to deal with another foreign substance when it is already being blasted with chemicals throughout our environment.

45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer)
comment: I have suffered from Diabetic Neuropathy, Fibromyalgia and Cervical & Lumbar Degenrative Arthritis,Insomnia, Anxiety and Menopause for the last 6yrs, which I have been treated with MANY prescription drugs and undergone treatment at pain clinic.  All of which has been no help in getting rid of the pain I suffer from daily.  Being desperate to find myself some help during some internet research I stumbled across info and user reviews about EPO helping with nerve pain so I decided to give it a try, as I had nothing to lose.  I have now been on an EPO treatment plan for two weeks taking 2(1,000 mg)in the AM and 3 (1,000 mg) PM.  My words for this pill is "MIRACLE." My neuropathy pain in my feet and hands is almost gone, I am able to sleep, feel my energy level increasing and have been able to take step downs of weaning myself off the prescription medications I have been taking that came along with terrible side effects.  I recommend this product to anyone that suffers from the health problems I have listed.  For the first time in years I feel I am beginning to finally get my life back I once I had before the onset of all my health problems started.  I'm so mesmerized about the results I'm seeing for myself that I want to share my news with anyone who is suffering as I was.

reviewer_info: 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
Angela, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Even after researching the likely effectiveness, I postponed trying Fish Oil for treating joint pain and depression until the day that I awoke with ALL JOINTS aching including a rather sudden limited mobility... Could be the placebo effect or some other contributing factor but I perceived SIGNIFICANT reduction in pain and COMPLETE mobility restored within the first 2-3 days! Simultaneously, my depressed mood improved very significantly. Chicken or the egg?  Both joint pain/mobility AND MOOD improved so significantly AND SO QUICKLY that I believe that the two were not significantly interrelated. Because dosage can be so confusing, I am providing the brand name, etc. I took "Nature Made Fish Oil 1200 mg", 360 mg Omega-3 twice daily. 

The breakdown from the label: Fish Oil Concentrate 2400 mg/total omega-3 fatty acids 720 mg (Omega-3 EPA 360 mg/Omega-3 DHA 240 mg/Other omega-3 120 mg). Again, I have been taking 2 softgels daily.

However, after reading reviews/ratings here, I may consider increasing this dosage from 2 to 3 softgels daily.  Thanks so much to all contributors!  This is an awesome resource for information!  Scientific studies necessarily lag behind first-hand experiences...

Try Fish Oil for joint pain and/or depression!! As some authorities, I feel most Americans could benefit from this one supplement!

reviewer_info: Laura, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
There isn't a category for anxiety, agitation, or mood swings, so I had to put my review under bipolar disorder.

I take 2000 mg of omega 3s in fish oil daily with fluoxetine (Prozac) and it makes a HUGE difference.  I drive much slower, I'm much more patient, and people don't aggravate me half as much.

Fish oil works by reducing inflammation in the brain on a sub-cellular level which allows the neurotransmitters in the brain to be able function more efficiently without misfiring (which is believed to be the cause of many mood disorders).

Regardless if you're suffering general anxiety, bipolar disorder, depression, or any number off issues, fish oil will only help.

Be sure to read the label, just because it says 1000 mg on the bottle means very little.  What is important are how many mg of actual omega 3s are in each capsule.  Most drug store brands have about 300mg of omega 3s and to be effective for mood disorders, you need 2000-3000 mgs of omega 3s daily.  Specifically EPA.

I hope this helps ..

reviewer_info: jtex, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment: Recommended by my primary care physician some 10 yrs ago, I've been routinely taking fish oil capsules containing Omega 3 ranging from 755 mg to 980 mg per capsule.  Brand name either Nature Made or Kirkland (not seen in drop-down menu).  Not sure if it is really effective against hypertension.  If did not take blood pressure pill (Amlodipine) on the same day for a few days, bld pres might (not always) increase, even fish oil was taken on those days.  Have recently suspended taking fish oil due to a July 2013 National Cancer Institute publication that fish oil supplement (Omega 3) can lead to prostate cancer.  Shall consult with doctor in next appointment.  Am surprised that WebMD does not mention and discuss this latest important finding to warn male readers.  A medical doctor on eHealth Forum reported he cut down fish oil supplement himself after reading the NCI article.  Also, I saw scientific articles that fish oil can lower platelet counts.  Did not see this info on WebMD--whether the finding is creditable or not.  Would like to see a response and discussion from WebMD.

reviewer_info: smokymtnlady, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment:
I have taken over the counter, Source Naturals Ultra Potency, Enteric coated, Omega 3 Fish oil, for approx 3 yrs. to help control high triglycerides.  Recently, my primary physician prescribed Lovaza. It is a more pure form of Omega 3 fish oil. It has worked well, in lowering triglycerides. It has also caused fewer fish burps, even though it is not enteric-coated. However, I have started developing intestinal problems, (bloating, gastritis, diarrhea, upper abdominal pain) after taking the fish oil. 
I always take Omega 3 with a meal, but the symptoms have become so uncomfortable, that I have stopped it. I even tried the over the counter capsules again, and I am getting the same side effects. 
I am sure it is the Fish oil causing stomach distress, after the process of eliminating all other possible causes. I may give myself a rest for a few weeks and try again, but intestinal problems are some of the side effects listed for all Omega 3 fish oils. 
*Wish I could continue taking it. It is a great product, if you can tolerate it!

reviewer_info: Smartjanitor, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment:
The short of it: I hate to be a party-pooper.  There's no *perceptible* difference that I can feel, and the very latest research from Yale, where the scientists combed through all the studies, is that the studies just don't show a connection between ingestion of EPA/DHA and relief of bipolar or depressive symptoms.  Michael Bloch's team at Yale found that there was no *meaningful* connection between use of DPA/EHA and these disorders.  (The article: Mol Psychiatry. 2012 Dec;17(12):1272-82. doi: 10.1038/mp.2011.100. Epub 2011 Sep 20.).

Then again, the research does indicate that omega-3s are helpful for cardiac pathology, and certainly they don't *harm* you, so I'm going to keep taking them.  I'm just going to be careful not to spend a fortune on them, and not to ignore other treatment options and put all my eggs in the Omega-3 basket.

Smartjanitor

reviewer_info: Tretiak, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: My MD advised I go on 2 grams of fish oil daily about 2 1/2 years for triglyceride control. The first 6 months went fine - no adverse events, but not much effect on the triglycerides. After 6-8 months, I slowly developed irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). I had been on the fish oil for so long, it did not occur to me that it could be the cause. The IBS slowly got worse to the point where I was tested for celiac disease and gluten intolerance - negative on both fronts. The IBS got to the point where I was having up to ten BM's a day - not diarrhea, just constantly in the bathroom. It was miserable -it was hard to go out for even a few hours. It actually caused me to change jobs from a 70% travel position to an inside position. I saw the 2013 NEJM data on the ineffectiveness of fish oil in cardiac conditions, saw my doc and told him I was going to discontinue the fish oil because it wasn't doing anything for the triglycerides and I saw no long term benefit. 4 weeks later ALL my IBS symptoms were gone. I told my doc and he was as shocked as I was - he'd never seen delayed onset IBS with fish oil. So if you have developed IBS in fish oil, talk to your doc and tell him that it can happen. It sucked, I'll never touch that product again as long as I live.

It was four inches across and travelled half way up my inner arm. It was hot to the touch and quite swollen. reviewer_info: dsk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I've been taking Gingko Biloba (and several other supplements) for about two months. Here are some symptoms I no longer have: tinnitus, high blood pressure, chronic fatigue.

One thing I *suspect* GB has done is to reduce the severity of a poison ivy rash. I get it late EVERY winter, and this year was no different...except in the severity. I still have the rash and redness all over my arms and some on my legs. However, there are no oozing, weeping blisters.

Last year, it was so bad that it went deeper than the skin and ate into my flesh in one spot...leaving a scar that's still there today. This year, it itches very little, the rash isn't very raised, and as I said, absolutely no blisters.

I'm wondering, because the GB plant can cause an allergic skin reaction, much like poison ivy...is it possible that ingesting the supplement has helped my body counteract the effects of poison ivy?

reviewer_info: concerned, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer)
comment: There are a few herbs that deserve much closer scrutiny. My experience has been first hand. Herbs dosages are critically important for some herbs. Ginkgo like yohimbe and ginseng is very concentrated and has powerful effects most commonly than not. We are far too reckless with these. I wouldn't experiment with Ginkgo unless a last resort is very necessary. Its your brain after all. Use a detox instead for your brain. Adrenals and hormone levels have been my first concern for aging fatigue, hair loss and male sexual function. For me Ginkgo is no good at all and difficult to be free of the side effects. Worse than chromium picolinate and may last years longer. If you have anxiety, stress or a mental issue such as depression seek a herbal holistic medical doctor instead of a maven or family practitioner

reviewer_info: Joelle, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Consumer)
comment:
I began using Boswellia (AOR Maxi-Boz, from Canada)about ten years ago for knee pain. I had been prescribed Boswellia before at the Arya Vaidya Shala Research Hospital in Delhi as part of a course of anti-arthritis treatment that worked very well. At the time they impressed on me the importance of using high quality supplements backed by research, which is why I chose AOR.

I've been pain free since starting Maxi-Boz and was able to get off the Naproxen I had been using. My joint mobility is also much better and I have much less musculo-skeletal pain in general. 

I haven't experienced any noticeable side-effects except occasional incense burps when I take it with too little water, and my blood chemistries have been consistently normal.

reviewer_info: MichSki, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
I will start by saying I am medically a bit weird. That being said, I take magnesium as needed for difficulty with concentration, anxiety, fatigue, and muscle weakness. I am diagnosed with polyendocrine issues related to autoimmune dysfunction, am in remission for myasthenia after a thymectomy, have PCOS, mild diabetes, and am subclinical but being monitored for Hashimoto's and Cushings. I have mild to moderate incontinence, and was told the magnesium might help with that as well...

That being said, I ONLY take my magnesium supplement when the symptoms I noted above (except the incontinence) become almost disabling, because of a horrible side effect - I feel such strong urinary urges that I feel like I have a UTI, my kidneys ache, and my bladder cramps, all on the day after I take a magnesium tablet. I drink extra water to try to alleviate some of it, with minimal results.

My supplement isn't in the list below - Nature's Bounty 500 mg high potency Magnesium.

I do not know if this is related to my genetics, the autoimmune situation specifically, or of it is something else. I wanted to bring it up here because I'm baffled by its usage as a urinary tract relaxant. That is not my experience.

reviewer_info: silver, 45-54 Female  (Consumer)
comment:
"The daily Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDA) for elemental magnesium are: Age 1-3 years, 80 mg; 4-8 years, 130 mg; 9-13 years, 240 mg; 14-18 years, 410 mg (boys) and 360 mg (girls); 19-30 years, 400 mg (men) and 310 mg (women); 31 years and older, 420 mg (men) and 320 mg (women). For pregnant women age 14-18 years, the RDA is 400 mg; 19-30 years, 350 mg; 31-50 years, 360 mg. For lactating women age 14-18 years, the RDA is 360 mg; 19-30 years, 310 mg; 31-50 years, 320 mg. For infants less than one year of age, adequate intake (AI) levels are 30 mg from birth to 6 months and 75 mg from 7 to 12 months. The daily upper intake level (UL) for magnesium is 65 mg for children age 1-3 years, 110 mg for 4-8 years, and 350 mg for anyone over 8 years old, including pregnant and breast-feeding women."

Sorry if I find this confusing......the RDA for some is 400mg or over....but the upper limit for anyone is 350mg???

reviewer_info: TracyB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment: Age 52, female menopausal: I take 160 mg (40% daily value) magnesium citrate (1 capsule) every evening with food, 1 - 2 hours before bedtime.  I also take a vitamin energy drink daily that has 200 mg of magnesium glycinate (50% daily value) each morning with food.  FYI: I also take an ace inhibitor in the evenings for blood pressure.  Warnings say that if you take a potassium blocker for blood pressure you may have an interaction, so be very careful!  I have consistently much lower blood pressure now than ever before.  On average: 90's/60s with a pulse rate in the low 70's. I have considerably less fibro pain, my heart palpitations are rare now and very mild (thyroid disease).  I have greatly reduced hot flashes and night sweats, greatly reduced irritability and anxiety, greatly reduced headaches and more energy throughout the day and better focus and concentration.  I am taking the magnesium side by side with 26 billion active bacteria (probiotics) each day.  I take these right before bed when I take my magnesium (because both give me putrid gas for several hours).  This is a side effect not mentioned on the labels of either product.  FYI.  But this it is the only adverse side effect Ive noticed that I have!  The combination of these two supplements has really improved my mood and overall sense of well being.  Anxiety and negative thinking is now rare and very short lived.  I no longer feel bloated because the digestive tract and bowels are moving, and I have more energy and a positive outlook.  I am amazed that probiotics can actually improve your mental acuity, focus and sense of well being!  Everybody should take these! Read about the immune system and how it effects EVERYTHING in the human body, especially the digestive system, heart and brain!  When I started using magnesium WITH high quality probiotics (I also am very self aware of my stress levels) my old self came back, but a better version.  A healthy diet with exercise make this work even better!

reviewer_info: Taylor, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
Recently, I was diagnosed with what my PCP calls "pharmaceutically-induced mood disorder." 2 years ago, I was on Abilify for a few months for trichotillomania (hair-pulling). I didn't have depression, anxiety, or any mood disorder; apart from the hair-pulling, I was completely healthy. After stopping Abilify cold-turkey (my doctor at the time told me this would be okay; she was WAY wrong), I experienced an intense 5-day-long anxiety attack.  Just constant panic, depression, crying, and depersonalization. On day 5, the "episode" ended just as suddenly as it began.

Ever since then, I'd have weeks of normalcy--even a slight euphoria--and then about 3 days of anxiety and depression that would, again, start without warning, and end just as suddenly.  Sometimes it was 3 days, sometimes more; sometimes it was so bad I couldn't function. Some episodes were more mild, but still very disrupting my life. I also began to pull more hair than ever.

I saw many doctors and was diagnosed with everything from General Anxiety, to Postpartum Depression (I gave birth a year ago), to Bipolar disorder. I knew in my heart the Abilify had caused this, somehow.

I read in a few forums about people having great success with TwinLab Amino Fuel, L-glutamine powder, and magnesium (all three taken together in the mornings on an empty stomach--I take 40 mL, 1 teaspoon, and 250 mg, respectively). I decided to give it a try, since I was desperate, and Abilify had scared me off psychiatric drugs permanently.

Within a week, I felt a LOT better. I started taking another 250 mg magnesium before bed, and now (2 months later) I feel even better, almost 100%. I do get "twinges" of anxiety now and then, but they are so mild and fleeting, I barely notice them; on these days I take an extra magnesium midday. I know the other supplements are helping a lot too, but the magnesium is great just by itself. It feels like I have my life back!! Highly recommend no matter what kind of anxiety you have.

reviewer_info: Joanie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: I have been taking "Natural Calm" which is a powdered form of Magnesium (ionic magnesium citrate, created from a highly absorbable proprietary blend of citric acid and magnesium carbonate).  It comes in a few different flavors (all natural), and it can be found at Whole Foods stores.  I mix a heaping tablespoon with a glass of water.  It is a relaxing, anti-stress drink, which I take at night (about 30-60 min. before bedtime),and it has helped me greatly in a number of ways:  Helps me to RELAX and SLEEP (I had been plagued with insomnia for years!), AND helps with REGULARITY (bowel movements, as I had also suffered with constipation my whole life).  I was diagnosed w/Fibromyalgia back in the early 1980's, and have tried so many different Rx's over the years, but would end up with unwanted side-effects from each med.  Now, I don't take any Rx meds, just the Natural Calm, plus have changed my diet, which has made a HUGE improvement!  If you're not familiar w/the Paleo diet, you would do yourself an unbelievable favor by checking into it.  It's basically eating REAL food, and eliminating all grains, sugars, and processed "foods".  Not only did it help with weight loss, but I FEEL SO MUCH BETTER in so many ways!  Less fatigue, more mental clarity, less fibro-pain, etc.  God bless each of you, in your quest to feel better and become a healthier individual!  :)

reviewer_info: Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Consumer)
comment:
Pros: I think it does help with ED, though probably not enough on its own. It seems to lower blood sugar or strengthen the effectiveness of insulin. 

Cons: Dry mouth and skin on hands feels really leathery when in water for more than a minute. Skin returns to normal and dry mouth is reduced after about a week or not using it. The lower blood sugar can also catch you off guard. Others have reported this supplement will cause an allergic reaction if you're allergic to pine. It's also expensive, particularly if labeled "Pycnogenol". Other cheaper supplements advertise similar benefits and you may want to consider those if you experience issues taking this or want to save money.

reviewer_info: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment:
I've never posted a review on this web-site, but I feel it's important to post this one for other people who may have pine allergies.
I purchased a skin serum with Pycnogenol as the primary ingredient. The intended use of the serum was to calm and soothe the easily irritated skin on my face. Certain foods & environmental factors make my skin very red and inflamed, and this product claimed to help with my symptoms. Unfortunately (and shame on me) I didn't realize that Pycnogenol is derived from Pine trees. I tested positive for "Pine Mix" during my allergy screening but never "put two and two together" when using this face serum. It took me about a month of being miserable, a trip to my allergy doctor, and tons of blood work to realize that the serum was making my allergies WAY worse. The primary adverse reaction that I had was dry mouth and subtle swelling of my tongue, which was very scary. It also seemed that while using this serum (twice/ day,) I was more sensitive to other foods/ environmental factors that set off my allergies.
In my opinion, if you have any kind of sensitivity to Pine, you should stay away from this ingredient.

comment: I've been using this product for well over a year for various reasons (slightly high blood pressure, slightly elevated cholesterol, fibromyalgia, and just for its general antioxidant properties). In the past year or so my blood pressure and my cholesterol improved and were within normal ranges. My fibrymyalgia also seemed to calm down some. In the past couple of weeks my blood pressure is elevated again and my fibromyalgia pain levels have increased. I have been baffled and concerned as to why all of a sudden this happened. It took me a few days to get it, but I realized that I ran out of my pycnogenol supplements and did not reorder because of all the holiday activities. reviewer_info: fl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
Lyndsay Ratson, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer)
comment: This tree has remarkably changed my life the first thing I would like to mention is there a 58 different varieties of the tree, and it grows in many different places such as India, Africa, the Philippines, Mexico, and Hawaii to name a few. But it grows best in places close to the equator.it's incredibly important to do your due diligence to research what variety you intend to take and its nutritional value.the variety that grows in India is actually the most nutrient dense. And was named plant of the year in 2008 by the National Institute of Health. it has also been quoted by John Hopkins University for saying it will in fact cure, treat, & arrest over 320 different diseases.it's also incredibly important to be seeing if your variety of Moringa is in fact organic, and it has to be fully organic. Which means no pesticides, herbacides or fungicides. it's also extremely important to look at how the tree was grown, and what conditions, and how the tree was harvested, which includes how it was dried. If it was dried in heat, or in the shade. Shade drying is much more expensive and time consuming, however it is critical to keep the bioavailabilityof the plant alive and heat/sun  drying will kill all of the nutrients which will mean you're basically eating grass clippings nutrition wise.my best suggestion to everyone reading this is to do your research, look for Moringa that comes with a guarantee in from a credible organic source.my own personal experience since I started using Moringa has been: I no longer suffer from the back pain the used to experience from being hit by truck 25 years ago, my energy levels are through the roof, my son who suffered from ADD issues have had phenomenal results with his mental clarity and ability to concentrate, my 4 year old daughter won't stop going through growth spurts, and we very rarely have a cold or the flu in our house. reviewer_info: stefvan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer)
comment: Daughter has come off of 2 daily asthma meds thanks to moringa oleifera.  We have both lost weight.  I have less joint and back pain.   Make sure you are buying from a company that uses the whole tree or you will not see all of the benefits.

NAC has helped me to stop biting my fingernails. The compulsion to bite was drastically reduced almost as soon as I started taking it, and that was enough for me to stop biting completely.
I started with 2000mg once a day (as per the instructions on the packet) and have reduced that to 1200mg split into a morning and evening dose. I bought it in powder form (it is actually small crystals and not really a powder) and it took me a while to figure out how best to take it. The method that works for me is that I mix it in warm water and then add a dash of OJ. The warm water is so that it dissolves fully and the OJ is to avoid the unpleasant taste and the acidic aftertaste. At first I experienced heartburn if I took it on an empty stomach but that isn't an issue any more - perhaps because of the reduced dose or the OJ. 
I am 42 years old and have been a nail-biter for as long as I can remember, so it is amazing to me that I have stopped thanks to a supplement.

reviewer_info: CharlesA, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
comment:
Helps with non stimulating energy in Chronic fatigue. Not sure why it's being used for cancer. I've read NAC was used by the scientific community to see if the drugs are killing cancer cells through the common mechanism of increasing reactive oxygen species.  If adding NAC stops the action of the anticancer agent, than it is assumed it was acting through oxidative action. In April 2010, Korean researchers reported on the action of NAC in combination with a proteosome inhibiting chemotherapy drug known as MG132.

 

 First they showed that MG132 increased the amounts of ROS in lung cancer cells and as expected, the drug slowed the rate of growth of the cancer cells. Then they treated the cancer cells with NAC.  The drug no longer slowed growth rates.   I found the following at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center: And preliminary results suggests oral NAC may help reduce chemotherapy-induced neuropathy (18). However, NAC accelerated lung cancer growth in an animal model
